text.text_translated: In the last 200 years, technology and health became better. This meant that fewer children died when they were young. This caused fast population growth. These large families had even more children who grew up. They then had their own families. However, things changed in the 1960s. Contraception is the use of methods to prevent pregnancy. It became more common. Now, the global average number of babies for each woman has dropped. It has gone down from six to only two.

feedback.feedback: The text is a perfect example of B1 writing. Sentences are short and clear. Vocabulary is simple and appropriate. The keyword 'contraception' is defined correctly. All facts from the original text are included and accurate.
